channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Does the Robin Hood Foundation Fight Trump Budget Cuts Without Saying ‘Trump’?
item.description: The Robin Hood Foundation, one of New York City’s biggest charities, is navigating tensions between its wealthy donors and the nonprofits it funds.

item.title: Witkoff Plans Visit to Gaza to See Hunger Crisis
item.description: Steve Witkoff met with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and was expected to visit an aid distribution site in the enclave.

item.title: I’m a former governor, an education leader, and mother to recent college grads. Gen Z alarms me with their financial illiteracy
item.description: Gen Z is the least financially literate generation on record. I see it in the workforce and with my own kids graduating college.

item.title: 20 jobs and careers AI is unlikely to ever touch, according to Microsoft
item.description: You'll want to avoid communications fields.

item.title: New Implant Offers Hope for Easing Rheumatoid Arthritis
item.description: The device stimulates the vagus nerve, signaling the body to tamp down the inflammation that contributes to the disease.

item.title: TripAdvisor cofounder admits he’s often ghosted on LinkedIn now that he’s stepped down—but a career expert says it could be a ‘blessing in disguise’
item.description: Tripadvisor’s former CEO, Steve Kaufer, has been on the receiving end of radio silence for years. A career expert says there are four ways to make the...

item.title: Modi’s ‘True Friend’ Trump Deals India a Big Blow With Tariff Threats
item.description: India’s prime minister has made a big effort to build closer ties using his rapport with the U.S. president, but critics say he is getting little in r...

item.title: One of Silicon Valley’s most prominent Democrats just said the party ‘really did alienate’ a huge chunk of the tech world
item.description: “I regret this and wish it didn’t happen,” LinkedIn cofounder Reid Hoffman said.

item.title: How Chainalysis turned tracking crypto criminals into big business
item.description: Today, the company operates in more than 30 countries and has raised $536 million in funding.

item.title: Kamala Harris Sells a Memoir About the 2024 Campaign
item.description: The former vice president has written a book about her run for president in 2024. It will come out next month.

item.title: Witkoff Plans Visit to Gaza to See Hunger Crisis
item.description: Steve Witkoff met with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and was expected to visit an aid distribution site in the enclave.

item.title: Trump Tells Russian Official to ‘Watch His Words,’ but He Bites Back Instead
item.description: The former Russian president Dmitri Medvedev offers President Trump a useful foil to criticize without rebuking Vladimir Putin, one analyst said.

item.title: U.S. Hits Brazil With 50% Tariffs and Sanctions in Sharp Escalation
item.description: The White House hit Brazil on Wednesday with a 50 percent tariff and sanctions on a justice overseeing investigations into former President Jair Bolso...

item.title: Modi’s ‘True Friend’ Trump Deals India a Big Blow With Tariff Threats
item.description: India’s prime minister has made a big effort to build closer ties using his rapport with the U.S. president, but critics say he is getting little in r...

item.title: After Backlash, Ukraine Votes to Restore Watchdogs’ Powers
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky’s move last week to neuter two anticorruption agencies drew the country’s first street protests since Russia’s invasion.
